title: Redis configuration
description:
Defines the Redis connection pools available to any functionality requiring Redis.

See: /docs/enterprise/throttling/global-rate-limit/

clusters.title: Cluster definitions
clusters.description: Defines all the clusters available to Redis functionality. The different components requiring Redis will access the pool based on its name

addresses.title: Addresses
addresses.description: The list of redis members that conform the cluster using the format `host:port`. All members must be WRITEABLE

items.title: Redis member
items.description: The address of a Redis member in the cluster

client_name.title: Client name
client_name.description: You can set how this connection shows in Redis when listing all the connections `CONN LIST`

conn_max_idle_time.title: Connection Max Idle Time
conn_max_idle_time.description: The maximum amount of time a connection may be idle. Should be less than server's timeout.Expired connections may be closed lazily before reuse. If <= 0, connections are not closed due to a connection's idle time.

conn_max_life_time.title: conn_max_life_time
conn_max_life_time.description: The maximum amount of time a connection may be reused. When the attribute is not declared, the connection does not expire

dial_timeout.title: Dial Timeout
dial_timeout.description: Dial timeout for establishing new connections

max_active_conns.title: Max active conns
max_active_conns.description: Maximum number of connections allocated by the pool at a given time. When zero, there is no limit on the number of connections in the pool.

max_idle_conns.title: Max idle conns
max_idle_conns.description: Maximum number of idle connections. The value `0` means connections not closed

max_redirects.title: Max redirects
max_redirects.description: The maximum number of redirects to follow when requesting a key that is in another instance

max_retries.title: Max retries
max_retries.description: The number of times you want to retry a Redis command using a different connection from the pool, applying a random delay between `min_retry_backoff` and `max_retry_backoff`. Use `-1` to never retry (it might not be a good idea)

max_retry_backoff.title: Max retry backoff
max_retry_backoff.description: Every retry is executed increasing randomly starting at the `min_retry_backoff` until the `max_retry_backoff` is reached. This is the longest possible time.

min_idle_conns.title: min_idle_conns
min_idle_conns.description: Minimum number of idle connections which is useful when establishing new connection is slow. `0` means connections are not closed.

min_retry_backoff.description: Every retry is executed increasing randomly starting at the `min_retry_backoff` until the `max_retry_backoff` is reached. This is the shortest possible time.

name.title: Connection name
name.description: The connection pool name. This is an arbitrary name used to reference this connection in other parts of the configuration needing Redis.

opentelemetry.title: OpenTelemetry
opentelemetry.description: The OpenTelemetry configuration establishing how to report Redis connection activity

disable_metrics.title: Disable metrics
disable_metrics.description: Disables any metrics of this Redis pool

disable_traces.title: Disable traces
disable_traces.description: Disables any traces of this Redis pool

traces_static_attributes.title: Static attributes
traces_static_attributes.description: Static attributes you want to pass for traces.

key.title: Key
key.description: The key of the static attribute you want to send

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the static attribute you want to send

password.title: password
password.description: Sets the password to connect to Redis.

pool_size.title: Pool size
pool_size.description: The pool size defines the number of concurrent Redis commands that can be executed by this Redis pool. Take into account that this only saves the connection time to the server, but, Redis will still be a non-concurrent service. When `0` it maps to its default 10

pool_timeout.title: Pool timeout
pool_timeout.description: Amount of time the client waits for a connection if all connections are busy.

tls.title: tls
tls.description: An object with any [client TLS configuration](https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/service-settings/tls/#client-tls-settings) to this connection

user_name.title: Username
user_name.description: The username to connect to Redis

connection_pools.title: Connection Pools
connection_pools.description: Defines all the connetion pools available to Redis functionality. The different components requiring Redis will access the pool based on its name

address.title: Address
address.description: The Redis host where you want to connect using the format `host:port`.
